newsitem.title: JAPAN: TIFFE euroyen futures market closed for holiday.
newsitem.headline: TIFFE euroyen futures market closed for holiday.

text.p: The TIFFE euroyen futures market is closed on Monday for a national holiday in Japan. It will re-open for trade as usual at 2400 GMT on Tuesday.
On July 18, the key March contract moved narrowly, subdued by a lack of fresh factors, to finally settle down 0.01 at 99.00.

In the longer end of the money market, around 60 billion yen of three-month certificates of deposit (CDs) were issued at 0.66 percent, while around 45 billion yen of one-month CDs were issued at 0.59 percent.
